name: METOPROLOL TARTRATE
indications: metoprolol tartrate tablet beta-adrenergic blocker indicated treatment : • hypertension , lower blood pressure . lowering blood pressure reduces risk fatal non-fatal cardiovascular events , primarily strokes myocardial infarctions . ( 1.1 ) • angina pectoris . ( 1.2 ) • myocardial infarction , reduce risk cardiovascular mortality used conjunction intravenous metoprolol therapy patients definite suspected acute myocardial infarction hemodynamically stable patients . ( 1.3 )
contraindications: • administer daily food meal . titrate weekly longer intervals needed tolerated . ( 2 ) • hypertension : recommended starting 100 mg daily , single divided doses . ( 2.1 ) • angina pectoris : recommended starting 100 mg daily , given two divided doses . ( 2.2 ) • myocardial infarction : starting depends upon tolerance intravenous metoprolol , full prescribing information . ( 2.3 )

[ usp controlled room temperature . ] protect moisture heat . dispense tight , light-resistant container defined usp using child-resistant closure . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions: metoprolol tartrate tablets contraindicated severe bradycardia , second-or third-degree heart block , cardiogenic shock , systolic blood pressure < 100 , decompensated heart failure , sick sinus syndrome ( unless permanent pacemaker place ) , patients hypersensitive component product .
indications_original: Metoprolol tartrate tablet is a beta-adrenergic blocker indicated for the treatment of: • Hypertension, to lower blood pressure. Lowering blood pressure reduces the risk of fatal and non-fatal cardiovascular events, primarily strokes and myocardial infarctions. ( 1.1 ) • Angina Pectoris. ( 1.2 ) • Myocardial Infarction, to reduce the risk of cardiovascular mortality when used in conjunction with intravenous metoprolol therapy in patients with definite or suspected acute myocardial infarction in hemodynamically stable patients. ( 1.3 )
contraindications_original: • Administer once daily with food or after a meal. Titrate at weekly or longer intervals as needed and tolerated. ( 2 ) • Hypertension: Recommended starting dosage is 100 mg daily, in single or divided doses. ( 2.1 ) • Angina Pectoris: Recommended starting dosage is 100 mg daily, given as two divided doses. ( 2.2 ) • Myocardial Infarction: The starting dosage depends upon tolerance of intravenous metoprolol, see full prescribing information. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Metoprolol Tartrate Tablets, USP are available containing 25 mg of metoprolol tartrate, USP.
                  
                  The 25 mg tablets having functional scoring are white to off white film coated, round, biconvex tablets debossed with ‘L150’ on one side and breakline on other side. They are available as follows:
                  
                  
                  NDC: 70518-3506-00
                  NDC: 70518-3506-01
                  NDC: 70518-3506-02
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BLISTER PACK
                  PACKAGING: 180 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  PACKAGING: 30 in 1 BOTTLE PLASTIC
                  
                  
                  Storage:
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.]
                  Protect from moisture and heat.
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP using a child-resistant closure.
                  
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
adverseReactions_original: Metoprolol tartrate tablets are contraindicated in severe bradycardia, second-or third-degree heart block, cardiogenic shock, systolic blood pressure <100, decompensated heart failure, sick sinus syndrome (unless a permanent pacemaker is in place), and in patients who are hypersensitive to any component of this product.
